com.analog.lyric.dimple.solvers.gibbs

Class GibbsSolverGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.options.AbstractOptionHolder
      • com.analog.lyric.options.LocalOptionHolder
        • com.analog.lyric.dimple.options.DimpleOptionHolder

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDimpleEnvironmentHolder, IDimpleEventSource, ISolverEventSource, ISolverFactorGraph, ISolverNode, IOptionHolder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SFactorGraph

    public class GibbsSolverGraph
extends SFactorGraphBase
    Solver-specific factor graph for Gibbs solver.

    Previously was com.analog.lyric.dimple.solvers.gibbs.SFactorGraph

    Since:
    0.07

      • getSolverFactor

        @Nullable
public ISolverFactorGibbs getSolverFactor(Factor factor)
        Description copied from class: SFactorGraphBase

        The default implementation simply returns Factor.getSolver(), which assumes that the factor's model is currently attached to this solver graph. Subclasses may override this to return a more precise type or to support solvers that can still be used when they are detached from the model.

        Specified by:
        getSolverFactor in interface ISolverFactorGraph
        Overrides:
        getSolverFactor in class SFactorGraphBase
        Returns:
        solver-specific factor representing the given model factor or else null.

      • getSolverVariable

        @Nullable
public ISolverVariableGibbs getSolverVariable(Variable variable)
        Description copied from class: SFactorGraphBase

        The default implementation simply returns Variable.getSolver(), which assumes that the variable's model is currently attached to this solver graph. Subclasses may override this to return a more precise type or to support solvers that can still be used when they are detached from the model.

        Specified by:
        getSolverVariable in interface ISolverFactorGraph
        Overrides:
        getSolverVariable in class SFactorGraphBase
        Returns:
        solver-specific variable representing the given model variable or else null.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Description copied from class: SFactorGraphBase
        Initialize solver graph.

        Default implementation does the following:

        • Initializes iterations and multithreading from options.
        • Invokes initialize on contents of graph in this order
          1. owned solver variables
          2. boundary solver variables (only if this is the root solver graph)
          3. solver factors
          4. solver subgraphs
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ISolverNode
        Overrides:
        initialize in class SFactorGraphBase

      • solveOneStep

        public void solveOneStep()
        Does one round of Gibbs sampling.

        Performs the equivalent of: 

         for (int restart = 0; restart <= getNumRestarts(); ++restart)
 {
     burnIn(restart);
     for (int i = 0; i < getNumSamples(); ++i)
     {
         sample();
     }
 }
        Specified by:
        solveOneStep in interface ISolverFactorGraph
        Overrides:
        solveOneStep in class SFactorGraphBase

      • burnIn

        public final void burnIn()
        Perform initial burn in.

        This invokes burnIn(int) with value zero.

      • burnIn

        public final void burnIn(int restartCount)
        Perform burn-in phase.

        This consists of randomly reinitializing values of variables in the graph that do not have fixed values and then performing getBurnInUpdates() variable updates.

        Burn-in is required for most graphs to ensure that the samples will be closer to the real distribution.

        Parameters:
        restartCount - is a non-negative number indicating which random restart is executing. This will be zero for the initial burn-in phase.

      • sample

        public void sample()
        Generate one sample.

        Simply invokes sample(int) with value one.

      • sample

        public void sample(int numSamples)
        Run more samples without initializing, burn-in, or random-restarts

        This is like iterate(int), except that while iterate just updates runs a specified number of single-variable updates, this runs a specified number of entire samples, where the size of a sample has already been defined in terms of number of either updates or scans.

        Parameters:
        numSamples - is a positive number indicating the number of samples to generate.

      • iterate

        public void iterate(int numUpdates)
        Performs specified number of single variable updates

        Note that the iterate() method for the Gibbs solver means do the specified number of single-variable updates, regardless of other parameter settings. The iterate() method behaves differently than for other solvers due to the fact that the SFactorGraphBase.update() method for Gibbs-specific schedules will update only a single variable. Also, multithreaded operation for Gibbs is not supported

        Specified by:
        iterate in interface ISolverFactorGraph
        Overrides:
        iterate in class SFactorGraphBase

        @Deprecated
public void setNumSamples(int numSamples)

        Sets the number of samples to generate per restart.

        Sets the value of getNumSamples() and the corresponding GibbsOptions.numSamples option to the specified value.

        Parameters:
        numSamples - must be a positive integer.

      • getMatlabSolveWrapper

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getMatlabSolveWrapper()
        Description copied from class: SFactorGraphBase
        Returns the name of a solver-specific MATLAB wrapper function that should be invoked from MATLAB to do the solve. The value or existence of the function is allowed to change depending on the parameters to the solver. The MATLAB function should take two positional arguments: the MATLAB FactorGraph object and the instance of this interface. The default implementation always returns null.
        Specified by:
        getMatlabSolveWrapper in interface ISolverFactorGraph
        Overrides:
        getMatlabSolveWrapper in class SFactorGraphBase
        Returns:
        name of MATLAB function used to do actual solve in MATLAB interface or null if there is none.
